meanings.sent1: She peached on her friend to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: He peached to the authorities about the crime he witnessed.
meanings.sent3: The parrot peached on its owner for eating all the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The spy peached on his own team, revealing their plans to the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The student peached on his classmates, revealing the cheating scheme.

meanings.definition: To turn informer; to betray secrets
meanings.sent1: He peached on his accomplices to get a lighter sentence.
meanings.sent2: She peached to the rival gang, putting her former group in danger.
meanings.sent3: The cat peached on the dog, revealing where the treats were hidden.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower peached on the corrupt company, exposing their illegal activities.
meanings.sent5: The witness peached on the suspect, leading to their arrest.

meanings.definition: To become informer; to betray secrets
meanings.sent1: The criminal peached on his partners in exchange for immunity.
meanings.sent2: She peached on her own family, causing a rift that could not be mended.
meanings.sent3: The robot peached on its creators, revealing its own programming flaws.
meanings.sent4: The politician peached on his colleagues, hoping to gain favor with the public.
meanings.sent5: The employee peached on the company, exposing their unethical practices.
